sentences.sContent: Silva issued a statement denying all knowledge of the affair.
sentences.sCn: 西尔瓦发表声明，宣称对此事一无所知。

sentences.sContent: a warning issued by the Surgeon General
sentences.sCn: （美国）卫生局局长发出的警告

sentences.sContent: ...self-orientation matters the most when it comes to a issue like this...
...It was the first government to issue banknotes in the whole history of the world and also the earliest to use gunpowder and invent the movable type printing...
...they stop working when a moral issue is involved...
...Part of the issue is that tribal groups themselves don't always believe their languages are endangered until they are down to the last handful of speakers...
...Part of the work-life issue has to talk about uncertainty about the future...
...Yellen is likely to address the issue right after she pushes unemployment below 6%...
...It is actually quite difficult to find reliable statistics on the issue for many schools...
...What issue does the author try to draw people's attention to...

synos.tran: 问题；流出；期号；[会计]发行物
[会计]发行，发布；发给；放出，排出
[会计]发行；流出；造成…结果；传下

phrases.pCn: 热点问题；[证券]热门股票（上市后不久价格猛涨）
v. 由…产生；传下；从…流出
现刊；现期杂志；近期杂志

trans.tranCn: 发行； 分发， 发出
trans.tranOther: to officially make a statement, give an order, warning etc
a subject or problem that is often discussed or argued about, especially a social or political matter that affects the interests of a lot of people
